title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, North-western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (25).

title: IMF urges Sri Lanka to promote investment, diversify exports amid tariff uncertainty
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says Sri Lanka must focus on diversifying its export markets and creating an investment-friendly environment to maintain stability and growth, even as recent tariff changes pose challenges to economic forecasting.

title: Another suspect arrested in Devinuwara double homicide
byline: Another suspect has been taken into custody in connection with the fatal shooting of two individuals near the southern gate of the Devinuwara Vishnu Devalaya, a crime that occurred on March 21, 2025.

title: Motorcyclist in Middeniya triple murder repatriated after arrest in India
byline: A suspect wanted in the recent triple murder at Middeniya, has been arrested in India and repatriated to Sri Lanka by officers of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: American rock band ‘Boyce Avenue’ arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Globally renowned American rock band ‘Boyce Avenue’ arrived in Sri Lanka on the night of April 24 ahead of their much-anticipated concert in the country.

title: Indian Army retaliates after firing by Pakistan along LoC days after Pahalgam terror attack
byline: Firing was reported from multiple Pakistani posts along the Line of Control by the Pakistan Army throughout the night.

title: ‘Opposition frightened by the thought of becoming irrelevant’ - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the opposition is frightened by the possibility of losing its relevance, and that if one wishes to surpass the National People’s Power (NPP), they must demonstrate their commitment to ending corruption and fraud.

title: Second day of postal voting commences for 2025 LG Polls
byline: Today marks the second day of postal voting for the upcoming local government elections.

title: China tells Trump: If you want trade talks, cancel tariffs
byline: China has called on the US to cancel its sweeping tariffs on Chinese goods entering the country as a sign that the President Donald Trump is serious about resolving the trade war between the two countries.

title: Foreign Minister to attend Pope Francis’s funeral mass in Vatican
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath will represent the Government of Sri Lanka at the funeral of His Holiness Pope Francis, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced.

title: President makes surprise visit to Kandy, meets ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ devotees
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake made an unannounced visit to Kandy yesterday (April 24) to meet with people queuing to participate in the ongoing ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’.
